metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30640 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability in the JNDI Realm of Apache Tomcat allows an attacker to authenticate using variations of a valid user name and/or to bypass some of the protection provided by the LockOut Realm. This issue affects Apache Tomcat 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.5; 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.45; 8.5.0 to 8.5.65.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30640` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtomcat9-embed-java - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
libtomcat9-java - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
tomcat9 - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
tomcat9-admin - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
tomcat9-common - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
tomcat9-examples - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
tomcat9-user - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
tomcat8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
tomcat9 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2').
